title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message:
Came in with a little teeny tiny speck of dust on U9300 and R9310 resistor above it.
Removed the chip, cleaned it up and install new resistors and few caps around it.. still 5V..
I took few measurements
[B]PPDCIN[/B] 5V (diode mode good according to OBD)
[B]PPBUS[/B] 12.27V (diode mode good according to OBD)
[B]PP3V8_AON[/B] 3.8V (diode mode good according to OBD)
[B]PP1V8_AON[/B] 1.8V
[B]PP5V_S2_MAIN[/B] was 2.9v and unstable goes up and down.. (diode mode: 0.406, it seems good as well) 
I took off U9300 suspecting maybe its pulling 5V S2 down.. but still 5V S2 was fluctuating..
To save time I changed UC260 ([B]5V S2 VR[/B]) directly.. and still 5V S2 was fluctuating..

I measured the enable signal ([B]P5VS2_PWR_EN[/B]) and it was low (0.550v) and unstable as well.. and it comes from MPMU U8100..
I measured [B]IPD_PWR_EN_PMU[/B] and it was absent.. [B]IPD_PWR_HOLD[/B] was absent too.

[B]5VS2_PWR_EN[/B] diode 0.714
[B]IPD_PWR_EN_PMU [/B]diode 0.714
[B]IPD_PWR_HOLD [/B]diode 0.692

I don't want to blame U8100 directly and since I need to order these chips and it requires a lot of time.. is there anything else I need to checkup? something I looked over?

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message: Did you check diode mode to ground on all secondary power supplies?

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message: Thanks for your response. I replaced the U9300 chip and it successfully fixed the issue.

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message:
This board after one month has returned.. customer complained the screen turned grey then it shut off.
I've received the computer, the board takes 5V 0.01-0.08A
[B]PPBUS[/B] 12.3V
[B]PP3V8_AON[/B] 3.8V
[B]PP1V8_AON [/B]1.8V
[B]PP5V_S2_MAIN [/B]5.1v
[B]PP1V8_S2 [/B]1.8v

U9300 should produces three power stages and they're present at 2.5v
[B]P1V8VDDH_DRMOS_PWM1[/B] & [B]P1V8VDDH_DRMOS_PWM2[/B] & [B]P1V8VDDH_DRMOS_PWM3

PP1V8_S1_CLVR_VDDH [/B]1.8v

[B]U8100[/B] bucks were present except for [B]PPVDD_AVEMSR_AWAKESW[/B] was missing on all coils and on both sides.

[B]PPVDD2H0_S2SW [/B]is present at 1v

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message:
All USB-C ports have the same behavior?
Tested disconnecting internal LCD?

Check if machine can complete DFU revive.

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message:
"All USB-C ports have the same behavior?"
yes exactly 

"Tested disconnecting internal LCD?"
I'm testing bare board 

"Check if machine can complete DFU revive." 
It won't go into DFU

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message:
Forcing is by wiring [B]SOC_FORCE_DFU[/B] to [B]SOC_FORCE_DFU_DBG [/B]based on the test pads on board is that correct or have I gotten it wrong?
If yes then it won't go DFU either

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message: Ok, I didn't know that I was doing it wrong.. can you please give be a brief steps since I've read logi and it confused me even more. Sorry for troubling you.

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message: There is a photo even, about how to connect a wire to force it.

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message:
The picture you're mentioning is for the M1 MacBook Air which has a different layout than the 14" MacBook Pro A2442. 

I spoke to Alexey to to get the numbers and orientation of the board correct for M1 Pro. 

Anyways, I have now 1.25v in SOC_FORCE_DFU still not going into DFU.. I tried bare board and I tried in housing with battery and charger plugged in same results not getting into DFU..

title: A2442 820-02098 5V
message: idk why and idk how, computer booted..
